title: Wreckfest
notes: Single Player seemingly works fine. Multiplayer server browser hangs. Doesn't detect refresh rates above 60Hz, though can push higher FPS using G-Sync. Have to lower settings for FPS parity with Windows.

title: Wreckfest
notes:
Performance: game runs good to okay.

Tested: 4 banger races, which went fine, some FPS drops, but overall was playable. 
Also did 1 demolition derby: this is really hard on my FPS, lots of FPS drops, this is just about playable.

Game didn't crash or have any other graphical glitches/audio glitches. So the game was stable in that regard for me.

title: Wreckfest
notes: single player works perfectly fine but multiplayer hangs, only 64-bit version works

title: Wreckfest
notes: Tried both 32 bit and 64bit options, 64 bit is giving out a failure to detect graphics device

title: Wreckfest
notes: The after race menu/results did not render correctly, but completely usable. Slightly low framerate at 3440x1440. Usually 30+, but could drop into 20's with lots going on. No other issues to report after 2 hours ingame.

title: Wreckfest
notes: Some graphic glitches in the Menus and some stutters across the game.

title: Wreckfest
notes: Stable no crashes, but has some graphical glitches in game.

title: Wreckfest
notes: white rectangle glitch in the menus, but in the background

title: Wreckfest
notes: Couldn't get it to run until I specifically selected Proton 3.7-3 in the Steam Play options. Everything seems to work, but performance is quite a lot worse than in Windows. (Note that Solus doesn't have LLVM 7 yet, though)
Steam loads the game for a while, but then nothing happens. Same for both 64 bits and 32 bits versions.
title: Wreckfest

notes: Runs well. Performance isn't perfect, but I can't compare to windows.

notes: Singleplayer is fine no issues during complete carreer- Multiplayer freezes game in multiplayer lobby, unable to close game only with killing process
